snippet: Senator Rob Portman, a moderate Ohio Republican seeking a second term, may lose Democratic voters with his opposition to nominating a new justice.
abstract: Sen Rob Portman of Ohio faces re-election in swing state, putting him in bind with respect to question of whether Pres Obama should be allowed to nominate replacement for Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia; Portman has vowed to block Senate consideration of any nominee, which has outraged many in his state, but his conservative Republican base is urging him to stand firm.

byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Senator Rob Portman, a moderate Ohio Republican seeking a second term, may lose Democratic voters with his opposition to nominating a new justice.

headline.main: Antonin Scalia Death Puts Swing State Republicans on Spot
headline.print_headline: For Ohio Senator, Delay in Filling Supreme Court Seat Risks Loss of Key Supporters
